So far about the only useful information that I have gotten from this course is...
A. Where to download Wrodpress.
B. A lot of people and companies use Wordpress.
All of the information that is being given is readily available on the Wordpress.org website. He is simply reading it to us.

results.content: too basic, also make a video how to develop a own wordpress theme and plugin

response.content:
This course was not meant to teach theme and plugin development. This is a beginner level course and the main goal of this course is to teach "How to use WordPress". I am happy that you are interested in theme and plugin development. And I am sorry that I can't do it in this course because the majority of our students are "Beginners" or "First Time WP users". 
Thank you
response.content_html:
This course was not meant to teach theme and plugin development. This is a beginner level course and the main goal of this course is to teach "How to use WordPress". I am happy that you are interested in theme and plugin development. And I am sorry that I can't do it in this course because the majority of our students are "Beginners" or "First Time WP users".
Thank you

results.content_html: too basic, also make a video how to develop a own wordpress theme and plugin

results.content: The Course is very basic. Maybe helpful if you've never worked with Wordpress. But if you have ANY experience, this course will be too basic for you. I think it's misleading to call it the "Complete Wordpress Website Developer Course". The accent of the teacher is annoying over time and a lot of the content could be shorter and more to the point.
results.content_html: The Course is very basic. Maybe helpful if you've never worked with Wordpress. But if you have ANY experience, this course will be too basic for you. I think it's misleading to call it the "Complete Wordpress Website Developer Course". The accent of the teacher is annoying over time and a lot of the content could be shorter and more to the point.

results.content:
Scrolling the wordpress.org website (and a couple of others) and reading its content with a lot of unnecessary emphasis is not really what you can define a "course".
Unless the next lessons are going to contain some actual content (hopefully something you cannot read by yourself on the WordPress website), I am afraid this course will result in a waste of time.

response.content: I am sorry that you are having bad experience with the course. But I want to teach my student that How can they solve a problem in WordPress or How they can search for information on WordPress and reading documentation is always a good practice. I want my student to learn actively not passively. That is my way of teaching and if you didn't liked the course at all then surely you can ask for refunds.
response.content_html: I am sorry that you are having bad experience with the course. But I want to teach my student that How can they solve a problem in WordPress or How they can search for information on WordPress and reading documentation is always a good practice. I want my student to learn actively not passively. That is my way of teaching and if you didn't liked the course at all then surely you can ask for refunds.

Scrolling the wordpress.org website (and a couple of others) and reading its content with a lot of unnecessary emphasis is not really what you can define a "course".
Unless the next lessons are going to contain some actual content (hopefully something you cannot read by yourself on the WordPress website), I am afraid this course will result in a waste of time.

The first few videos, while well made, were kind of simple. I had already taught myself everything  in them. That's not the fault of the person who made the videos, though. He's just making it simple for people who can't figure things out that well. I get it.

Still though . . . . . You should have seperate classes for those of us who are already familiar with web development.

results.content:
Just don't. I know it's free and I appreciate his effort, but this is just too much.

His English is simply not on the Udemy-education level, I'm sweating trying to understand what he's saying.

He spends 4 parts or half an hour repeating the sentence "Wordpress is soooo powerful, SO powerful!", reading individual companies that use WP, one by one, then reading how much some people charge to do web site for you, again individually with reading numbers, I just can't.

A lecture just ended mid sentence.

There's children in the background shouting and playing while he talks.

The new lecture just started and I'm having a hard time hearing him cause there's a bunch of cars in the background honking.

Just pay for some decent lesson and learn.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Honestly, The Course was excellent.
But it had some flaws which can be improved in further courses.
1 The audio was not balanced (like it was too high or too low).
2. Don't use offensive words (hell, weird, fu*k), it seemed unprofessional.
3. Don't use repeated sentences.
Don't take it as a negative feedback you can overcome from this.
results.content_html:

results.content: I really like this course, the course speaker is kinda funny haha. He really tried his best to teach everything about WordPress clearly, in the best way he can - really for beginners. But I don't like the inconsistency of the course audio. In some course lectures,  the audio is fine, while some the course audio is so low. Also, the greetings of the course speaker is inconsistent, he does a shouting greeting and a whisper one haha I need to re-adjust my volumes frequently. But overall great course.

results.content: The content is OK, I guess. But the form is bad. Bad English, occasional background noises, phone calls, kids, traffic, you name it, and if there's, e.g., some trouble with network connection, download times, etc., it's there in the video, no attempt has been made to fix that in a new shot. I feel bad giving this rating, since I took this course with a voucher for free, but the normal price is 99 EUR, which is just not right for this level of quality. Sorry :-(

results.content:
What I like are;
1. It's Free.
2. His content delivery is very enthusiastic.
3. He is beginner friendly as well.
4. The whole lectures are in the flow.
What are lacking;
1. He could have worked a little hard and created a very beautiful website. He showed the technical part but the creativity part would have made the whole course very memorable and  relative for the learners.
2. I think he needs to be slightly more professional, I think, but other may like his style.

Overall, I thank him for this opportunity for making me feel that it's not that difficult.
results.content_html:

results.content:
Although I have some experience with web development, I learned many new things from this course and refreshed my skills on the basics. The course was very comprehensive and the instructor was highly enthusiastic about his subject and presented it well.

I had some problems with the pace of the course and his foreign accent which is due to the fact that I have some hearing loss. I would recommend slowing things down a bit and providing more examples.

I am already implementing some of the content in this course. A good job overall.

response.content: Thank your for the review. I really appreciate it.
response.content_html: Thank your for the review. I really appreciate it.

results.content_html:

I had some problems with the pace of the course and his foreign accent which is due to the fact that I have some hearing loss. I would recommend slowing things down a bit and providing more examples.

I am already implementing some of the content in this course. A good job overall.

results.content:
Для меня как новичка в Wordpresse все в новинку и необычно, так же надо учесть что мой английский не очень хорош.
Однако я успешно понимаю и могу сам делать подобные вещи без особого труда, До этого курса пытался разобраться в этой теме самостятельно и успех не был так прост, если по честному его вообще не было. Я забрасывал дело не успев толком разобратся. Возможно более опытным людям будет скучно из-за подробного объяснения и неспешной манеры преподавателя - однако для меня самый лучший вариант. 
Спасибо автору и успехов ему.
